Subject: Laminar flame speed and thermal conductivities of gas mixtures
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=208950116
X-Yahoo-Profile: hpeterjoo
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 21 Dec 2004 17:30:31 -0000
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.94.237.50



To start, I am not a programmer and the closest thing to it is the DOS
based STANJAN. ...please don't laugh. 

All I want to do is calculate the thermal conductivities of various
fuel/oxidizer gas mixtures, i.e., methane/air, methane/oxygen gas
mixtures. It seems very simple. Unfortunately, I have no clue on how
to write a "script" file. Without learning python language, what would
be the basic commands to accomplish this?

Secondly, how do you calculate laminar flame speed? Is it possible?
i.e., methane/oxidizer?  Can you give me some directions on the commands.

Also, where and how would I be able to learn more on the functions and
capabilities of Cantera and how to use them?

(I managed to fianlly install Cantera on my computer. I'm using 1.5.4
with python 2.3.4)
